alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 1:52PM MST until December 08 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for valleys, with 4 to 8 inches from Essex to Marias Pass. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches in the Whitefish and Swan Ranges. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Essex, Marias Pass, Polebridge, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, and Bad Rock Canyon. * WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Outdoor recreationalists should be prepared for winter conditions. Snowfall could impact roads and cold temperatures may result in hypothermia.
